intro: Gnaphalium catipes, commonly known as the slender cudweed, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, stream banks, and other wet habitats, often forming dense mats. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in clusters. Gnaphalium catipes is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
